Class PlayerService

java.lang.Object
com.CEN30241.nflms.service.PlayerService
public class PlayerService extends Object
The PlayerService class provides methods for managing players and their statistics within a database, including retrieving, adding, and removing players.

    The DatabaseConnection class manages connections to the database.

  • Method Details

    • getAllPlayersFromDatabase

      public List<Player> getAllPlayersFromDatabase()
      Retrieves all players from the database.
      Returns:
      a list of Player objects retrieved from the database.

    • addPlayerToDatabase

      public void addPlayerToDatabase(Player player)
      Adds a player to the database.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player object to add to the database.

    • removePlayerFromDatabase

      public boolean removePlayerFromDatabase(String playerName)
      Removes a player from the database.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the player was successfully removed; false otherwise.

    • getPlayerByName

      public Optional<Player> getPlayerByName(String name)
      Retrieves a player by their name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player to retrieve.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the Player if found; otherwise, Optional.empty().

    • getStats

      public List<Stats> getStats(String playerName)
      Retrieves the statistics for a given player by their name.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player.
      Returns:
      a list of Stats objects for the player.

    • getPlayersStatsForComparison

      public List<Stats> getPlayersStatsForComparison(String player1Name, String player2Name)
      Retrieves the statistics for two players by their names for comparison.
      Parameters:
      player1Name - the name of the first player.
      player2Name - the name of the second player.
      Returns:
      a list of Stats objects for the players.
